Class LeagueIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • LeagueIO

  • public class LeagueIO
extends Object
    The LeagueIO class is the user interface for entering, updating and displaying information regarding multiple leagues. Within the league IO the users inputs are passed to the classes to create or modify objects. A static Arraylist of leagues is held.
    Author:
    Gary Carr

    • Method Detail

      • createFixtures

        public static void createFixtures(League l)
        This method creates all possible fixtures for the league after it is imported from the text file. A unique date is then applied to the match.
        Parameters:
        l - This is the league the fixtures will be added to

      • inputLeague

        public static void inputLeague(String fname)
        This method is called upon through the console IO from Main to allow a user to import a complete league of clubs and players from a text file
        Parameters:
        fname - This is the path to the file
        Throws:
        IOException
        FileNotFoundException

      • inputMatch

        public static void inputMatch(String fname,
              League l)
        This method is called upon through the console IO from matchSubMenu to allow a user to import multiple results from a text file
        Parameters:
        fname - This is the path to the file
        l - This is the league the match belongs to
        Throws:
        IOException
        FileNotFoundException

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Entry menu into League IO. Allows user to import a league from the test date, add league from a file, or start with no leagues
        Parameters:
        args - Program arguments
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws exception if file not found

      • modifyClubsWithinLeagueMenu

        public static void modifyClubsWithinLeagueMenu(Club c,
                               League l)
        Menu page allows user to make changes to the details of the club or access players within the team
        Parameters:
        c - This is the club that has been selected to modify
        l - This is the league which the club belongs to

      • printLeagues

        public static String printLeagues()
        Method prints all the leagues contained within the ArrayList leagueList
        Returns:
        Returns the list of the available leagues in ArrayList leaguelist

      • selectClubsInLeague

        public static void selectClubsInLeague(League l)
        Menu page allows user to select a club within the league for modifying
        Parameters:
        l - Displays all clubs that have been added to this league

      • selectPlayerInClubMenu

        public static void selectPlayerInClubMenu(Club c,
                          League l)
        Method displays all players in the club and prompts the user to select one for editing
        Parameters:
        c - This is the club that the player belongs to
        l - This is the league that the club belongs to

      • setClubName

        public static void setClubName(Club c,
               League l)
        Method allows the user to change the clubs name and then passes it to the club class for exception checking
        Parameters:
        c - This is the club which is being modified
        l - This is the league the club belongs to

      • setNewHeight

        public static void setNewHeight(Player p,
                Club c,
                League l)
        Menu page allows the user to assign a new height to the player. The height is then passed to the player class for exception checking
        Parameters:
        p - This is the player selected
        c - This is the club the player belongs to
        l - This is the league the club belongs to

      • setNewLeagueName

        public static void setNewLeagueName(League l)
        Method allows the user to change the name of the league
        Parameters:
        l - This is the league that has been accessed

      • setNewName

        public static void setNewName(Player p,
              Club c,
              League l)
        Method allows the user to assign a new name to the selected player. The name is then passed to the player class for exception checking
        Parameters:
        p - This is the player selected
        c - This is the club the player belongs to
        l - This is the league the club belongs to

      • setStadium

        public static void setStadium(Club c,
              League l)
        Method allows the user to change the stadiums name
        Parameters:
        c - This is the club which is being modified
        l - This is the league the club belongs to

      • toFile

        public static void toFile(String fname,
          League l)
                   throws IOException
        Method writes the league details, club details, players in the club, and writes the league table to a text file
        Parameters:
        fname - This is the filename the user types in. The program will then create a new file of this name
        Throws:
        IOException
